alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 5:46AM PST until March 01 at 9:10AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. .Flooding continues or is forecast for both the Satsop and Skookumchuck rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Satsop River Near Satsop. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands and some roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 38 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting right at minor flood stage and will fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.8 feet on 12/16/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 915 AM PST.
